title: UI typography refresh and FarmerForm sectioned responsive layout

requirements.summary: Apply a consistent, more modern typographic theme and refine styling across LoginPage, Header, FarmerForm, and SettingsDialog without changing behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: A new, coherent visual theme is applied consistently across main screens (login + main app).
Typography is noticeably improved: clearer heading sizes/weights, consistent label/body text sizing, and a modern font family applied globally.
No user-facing text is changed from non-English to non-English; keep all user-facing text in English.
No changes require backend updates; the app remains functional and form submission behavior is unchanged.

file_operations.description: Add a modern, globally applied font (e.g., via a hosted font link) and any needed preconnects so the app uses a consistent font family throughout. Keep existing app bootstrapping intact.
Update global typography defaults: set the new font-family on body, tune base text rendering, and standardize heading/label/body sizing using Tailwind base layer conventions (no new features).

Refine LoginPage typography and spacing (heading hierarchy, label/body consistency, subtle card spacing) while continuing to compose existing shadcn/ui components (Card, Input, Button). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Refine Header typography (brand title/subtitle hierarchy, badge sizing, spacing) and ensure consistent contrast and alignment while continuing to compose existing shadcn/ui components (Button, Badge). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Align FarmerForm typography with the global theme (section headings, labels, helper text, error text spacing) while keeping all validations, dependencies, and submission behavior unchanged and continuing to use existing shadcn/ui components (Card, Input, Button) plus the existing SearchableSelect. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Refine SettingsDialog typography and spacing (dialog title/description hierarchy, alert text sizing, list readability) while continuing to compose existing shadcn/ui components (Dialog, Alert, Button, Label). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Adjust Footer typography and spacing to match the refreshed theme (consistent muted text sizing/leading) without changing content or links.

requirements.summary: Restructure FarmerForm into three labeled sections (MGO/ST, Farmer, Crop) with the same validations, dependencies, and submission payload.
acceptanceCriteria: The form renders three distinct, labeled sections: MGO/ST, Farmer, and Crop.
MGO/ST section contains: ST, MGO Headquarters (and keeps the existing dependency behavior: MGO Headquarters disabled until ST is selected).
Farmer section contains: Farmer Name, Mobile Number, Village, District, Taluka (and preserves district→taluka dependency behavior).
Crop section contains: Wheat Variety, Crop 1, Crop 2, Irrigation Type, Total Acreage.
Login ID remains read-only and visible (placement can be above sections), and the submit button still submits the same data successfully.
All existing validations and error messages still trigger appropriately for their fields.

file_operations.description: Reorganize the FarmerForm JSX into three visually separated groups with clear section titles: (1) MGO/ST info, (2) Farmer info, (3) Crop info. Keep Login ID read-only and visible above sections. Preserve ST→MGO HQ and District→Taluka dependency behavior, and do not alter validation rules or the submission payload. Continue composing existing shadcn/ui components (Card, Input, Button) and the existing SearchableSelect. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Improve FarmerForm responsiveness using section-level structured layouts (stacked on mobile, multi-column on larger screens) while keeping existing shadcn/ui components intact.
acceptanceCriteria: On small screens, fields remain easy to read and interact with (no cramped multi-column layout).
On larger screens, related fields are arranged to reduce excessive vertical whitespace (e.g., District/Taluka side-by-side where appropriate).
No input, select, or button becomes inaccessible or visually clipped at common breakpoints (mobile, tablet, desktop).

file_operations.description: Within each of the three sections, apply a responsive Tailwind layout (e.g., single-column on small screens and 2-column grid on md+ where appropriate) to reduce scrolling. Ensure dependent selects (MGO HQ, Taluka) remain usable, and keep all shadcn/ui components (Card, Input, Button) and SearchableSelect intact (compose only; do not edit ui components). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
